intro: Phyteuma orbiculare var. suffultum, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a perennial plant native to Europe. It features showy, violet-blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a tall, slender stem. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
